GameMaker Mini Tutorial: Test on Android Wirelessly

If you‚Äôre developing Android games with GameMaker and want to test them on your device without the hassle of cables, you can set up wireless debugging using ADB (Android Debug Bridge). This guide walks you through the steps to configure your PC and Android device for wireless debugging and connect GameMaker to your phone.

‚úÖ Step 1: Locate ADB on Your Computer

ADB is part of the Android SDK platform tools. To find it:

  1. Open File Explorer on your PC.
  2. Navigate to: 
    [Your android SDK location]\Android\Sdk\platform-tools

  3. Inside this folder, you‚Äôll see an executable called adb.exe. This is the tool you‚Äôll use to connect wirelessly.

üì° Step 2: Enable Wireless Debugging on Your Android Device

You‚Äôll need to turn on wireless debugging from your Android‚Äôs developer settings:

  1. Go to Settings on your phone.
  2. Tap About Phone and find the Build Number. Tap it 7 times to enable developer mode.
  3. Go back to Settings and open Developer Options.
  4. Scroll down search for USB Debugging - right below it, enable Wireless Debugging.
  5. Tap the Wireless Debugging text to open the settings page.
  6. Select Pair Device with Pairing Code.
  7. We‚Äôll be using the pairing code in the next step! (so keep that page open on your phone)

üì° Step 3: Pair Your PC to Your Android Device

Now that wireless debugging is on, you‚Äôll need to pair your device with your PC.

  1. Open Command Prompt on your PC.
  2. Navigate to the platform tools folder where adb.exe is located:
  3. To pair your phone, run: 
    adb pair [IP address]:[Port]

    üëâ The IP address and port are displayed on your phone‚Äôs Wireless Debugging settings page.

  4. Enter the pairing code shown on your phone when prompted.
  5. Once paired, your phone will confirm the connection.

üîó Step 4: Connect Your Device Wirelessly

After pairing, you‚Äôll need to connect your device for debugging:

  1. In the same Command Prompt window, type: 
    adb connect [IP address]:[Port]
  2. It should now say connected.

üéÆ Step 5: Detect Your Device in GameMaker

Now that your device is connected:

  1. Open GameMaker.
  2. Go to Targets from the top toolbar.
  3. Select Device Editor.
  4. Click Detect Devices.
  5. Your phone should appear as an available target for testing.

‚ö†Ô∏è Troubleshooting: Connection Issues

Wireless debugging can sometimes disconnect randomly.

If this happens simply type adb connect [IP address]:[Port] again in Command Prompt to reconnect.

That‚Äôs it! Now you can build and run your GameMaker projects wirelessly on your Android device. üéâ
